title: Can we stop with "It's just normals" or playing while drunk/high?
body:
It's pretty toxic to go into a game like this.  It's one thing in bots or with a team of friends...but it ruins the game for many other people.

The mentality of "it's just normals" means you're coming into a team based game not really caring about winning.  Winning isn't everything, but loosing because a team mate just doesn't care and thinks it's cute to just screw around isn't fun for anyone but the person screwing around.  

Coming into a game stoned or high, again, is one thing with a team of friends, or even in bots...but coming into a game with other people inhibited just makes you a liability.  I'm not in any way shape or form saying I'm the golden child, but this needs to stop.

Can we please do something about this?

[EDIT]

Since everyone seems to be obsessing about having the 'right' to be fucked up and dick off in normals, and saying I should play ranked when I just want to play, lets say, my 1 a day for my BE I guess I seem to be the minority that doesn't enjoy watching people be retarded because that's how they enjoy the game.
Everyone has taken it personally, which leads me to believe that anyone who's responding in a volatile manner is exactly the person that gets fucked up or starts to be a hindrance and responds with 'I'm stoned/drunk' or 'it's just normals.'  
You do you, if you end up with someone like me, don't be surprised if we just wait for the game to end.  Being stoned/drunk is no excuse to be a burden.  'Relax its normals so I don't wanna give a shit' is no excuse to be a burden.  If that's your mentality, go play with a 5-man or go play with bots.

replies.body: Going into a game drunk or high isnt the issue, some people perform better that way. A lot of people will also say theyre drunk or high to excuse a mistake they made, theyre often lying. I think you'd be much better off either not playing norms and taking your game into ranked or just focusing more on improving yourself instead of being hung up on how other people play the game.

Since I main support (since most of the community hates the fuck out of it and someone needs to try to stop bot lane from going nuts) there's only so much I can improve when I have a mid feeding to shit, or a jungle lost in the bushes and snuggling the bunnies, or a top being...well...I dunno.  Does top lane do things other then gank bot and go for dragon often lately?  Or an adc who refuses to take advantage of things in some cases.

I have my super garbo games...like...impressively terrible sometimes.  I do try to improve.  But ranked is beyond cancer and I have to deal with a lot of the same stuff on top of inters because I am stuck in bronze.

I don't want to have to 'learn to carry' or whatever...I enjoy the support roll, lets me plan and think about what I can do to be most useful as opposed to just trying to marauder in combat.  My secondary is jungle, but if I don't support, most supports I get on my team kind of throw because they don't want to support or they argue with the adc from the getgo.

I just want to be able to enjoy my normals and not deal with people being asshats because they're being selfish and screwing the game up for 3-4 other people.

Playing while being drunk or high does not mean you are not going to try, like stated before, some people somehow play better this way (which is not something that applies to me since when im drunk, I sometime ult the raptors as nami).

However, should they be punished just because they are in a state of mind that reduce their gaming capacity even though they are still trying but having fun in the same time? Call me selfish or anything, but if you want this to happen to someone in a  game mode where you dont lose much (only time) I think you are the selfish one. 

If this happened in a rank game, then yes, report him or w/e (and im talking about those that doeskin play as well when they are in one of the states stated above) but to punish someone who is trying to have a nice time with one of his friend because he maybe had a bad week and he/she ruined ONE of your games in the day, that sounds selfish.

Im not saying you shouldnt be upset about it, some people borderline int when they are drunk/high but you have to understand, is it really fair to punish someone in a game mode that doesn't have much value just because it was a bad game?

>is it really fair to punish someone in a game mode that doesn't have much value just because it was a bad game?

Absolutely, because (permanent) game modes are roughly equal in value. There's a few exceptions I can think of (e.g. potential pro prospects, Bronze/Silver/Gold rewards boundary), but there isn't much difference otherwise. If you're grinding in ranked, you're probably doing it for either bragging rights or to test your own abilities. Both of those reasons are just as applicable to any other (permanent) game mode and aren't exclusive to ranked. Similarly, you're "only losing time" in ranked as well, since you can make up for it by playing more games.

I don't think being impaired or "it's just <x" are quite worth punishment by themselves, but they'd absolutely be a tipping point between "just questionable" and "reportable."

Side note:  it seems significantly more selfish to ruin a game for up to nine other people than to punish that one dude who maybe had a bad week.

Up to 9 people.

You are not ruining the game for the enemy team, as a matter of facts, they might actually be laughing. Second of all, if hes playing with a friend, hes *ruining* the game for 3 people in total. 

The difference between rank and normals are that rank has a value to the game. You can go with the argument that it feels like you're wasting your time because of him, but who says that you wouldn't of gotten a teammates whos having an unlucky game and is feeding? Second of all, you're assuming that having someone who is drunk is an insta lose because they intentionally feed or something, clearly, you haven't played with someone who is drunk. 

They are going to most likely make some bad plays, but that doesn't mean they are going to intentionally feed and not do some good plays here and there.

Understand what I mean for value, in normals, theres no LP, in ranks, theres LP. Yes, every game mode as a value to prove yourself, but ranks has numbers in it. That alone makes it worst then in any game mode that doesn't have this.

You're ruining the game for the enemy team if they wanted a challenging match. Given that they're clearly not queuing against bots, "wanting a challenge" is a fairly reasonable assumption.

It doesn't matter if I *would* have gotten a feeding teammate because I *did* get a teammate that's negatively affecting my gameplay experience. It'd be like excusing a guy spouting racial slurs while puking on the bus because "who says someone else wouldn't have been trying to punch you?" Considering what you might have gotten instead is a completely irrelevant discussion.

Furthermore, at what point did I say anything about insta-losing?

As for ranks and values, every PvP game mode has MMR, and every single game mode has numbers. The value of all of these things is completely subjective, since it has a different meaning to each player. Maybe Alice is ecstatic she finally hit Plat. Maybe Bob is anxious that he's only Plat. Maybe Carol doesn't care about being Plat and just wants to be +300 in ARAM. For the most part, those values, ranks, or numbers only mean as much as you personally want them to mean.

So let me get this straight.

If an individual is affecting negatively the game, even if that individual is trying his best, he should be punished for it because you want a challenge.

So, in the end, going bard jungle is just as bad then playing while being drunk at this point if thats what I understood from your argument.

Not only that, theres a game mode thats created exactly for people who crave a challenge. This game mode is called ranked. 

So its also fair to have the assumption that not everyone goes in normals with the expectation of wanting a challenge. 

Because someone wants the game to be played a particular way does not mean that everyone should go with it. Some people play normals for fun, you should accept that. Some people plays normals for competition, which I dont understand, and thats also fine and should be accepted. As I say to people, as long as you try, im happy with that. Nobody should be punished because they are having fun in a non competitive environment as long as they are trying. If this individual in question is actually just doing everything he can to fuck over the game over and over again, then yes, punish him.

However, if someone who is drunk is trying to play the game and win but is just too affected by the alcohol, thats in my opinion fine as long as its a non competitive environment.

Wait, so if I'm understanding your argument, we've been arguing roughly the same point.

Some people are looking for fun; other people are looking for competition. Both goals are fine, and there isn't a "correct" way. Don't try to ruin someone else's enjoyment though, whether competitively (e.g. feeding) or emotionally (e.g. flaming).

Essentially, "don't be a dick."
---
The part we seem to be disagreeing about is "non-competitive environment." Every (permanent) PvP game mode can be competitive to me. I may not personally consider a particular mode competitive, but I can certainly understand that someone else might. Maybe they really enjoy that mode, and maybe ranked simply isn't offered as an option for that mode. Likewise, competitive players should understand that some players might be more casual in their approach. Either way, it's just common courtesy to compromise between competitive and casual.

That's why "high af lmao" or "lol its just <X>" is so irritating. It often conveys a meaning of "I don't care about this game/mode, so no one else can/should either." Similar to "gg ez" at the end of matches, it's only a minor thing, but it's still pretty disrespectful to other players.

Im glad we are not so off the same point.

Essentially, you are right, the problem of why I commented in the first place is that the writter said that people who plays drunk should be punished which is, imo, really unfair since some people can control themselves or atleast not play like dicks when they are drunk.

Learning how to carry is pretty important, regardless of what you like playing--It's one thing to enjoy playing support over something like ADC or JG and another thing entirely to not know how to play them.

Not knowing how is arguably a bigger liability than the occasional player who smokes bud before a match, because if you can't play it you probably don't fully understand all the ways to play against it either.

https://imgur.com/a/38eGk No salt intended, lets look at this match and see what you could have done better. (You'll never be able to make team mates better, only you)

Let's talk about itemization, and I'll try to be unbiased towards zoe support.

I see that you took Coin, which is kind of a toss up for me between spellthief and coin, but really I don't personally have an issue with Coin, but I feel that maybe with the amount of mobility they have (Mainly lucian) the active of frostqueen would be better. Thats just a theory tho I'm willing to waver on that one.

But the second issue I see, and its the biggest issue. 

The Swifties.

Swifties got nerfed to shit a while back, so them alone aren't even that good, but you have to look at what you're going up against.

You have slow reset boots against a team with very little slows.

Xayah has a root
Rek has a knockup
TF has a stun
Lux has a root (and a slow)
and lucian has a slow (I think its a slow)

So buying a nerfed item in a sub optimal spot puts you even further behind by honestly just making you less of a threat.

{{item:3117}} is generally the best bet for most aggro supports, since having that increased mobility allows you to reposition better, faster, and more aggressively. And since none of Zoe's abilities go through minions, repositioning is very important.

Lux's slow is a pain to deal with, but if you play around its cool down the bonus ms from mobis which procs within 5 seconds, allows you to counter attack lux soon after while her slow is still on cd, greatly lowering her kill potential.

Also a benefit to mobis is roaming. If you're confident in your zoe play roaming up to mid and tkaing a chunk out of the mid laner will defintely help your team.

The other thing im seeing you build is a zzrot, which I really really don't agree with. The mr and armor is good, and the lane pushing is good too, but you would vastly benefit more from building some ap or even utilty item like solari if you absolutely must protect your adc and team from burst damage.

I guess you're going for the spell book zzrot push thing, but really that doesn't work well with zoe because you're missing out on her core strength, nuking people. I would take either Aery or Arcane comet, and possibly domination or inspiration as the secondary, because I feel like you're missing out on a ton of potential damage that you could be dealing, and you could be a mmmmuuuuuch bigger threat.

I also see you're maxing your E, which lets look into that (its not right btw)

Paddlestar (Q) scales off of AP and your Level.
Your E only scales off of AP.

So basically when you max your E (so you'd have 3 points in e by level 6).

The CD on Q with no runes or anything, at rank 3 is 6 seconds, and deals minimum of a total of 250. Thats the minimum, and you can cast 2 Q's in the span of time it takes your E to come off of cd.

E at rank three will at msot give you a bonus of 280, and thats if you land it. if you throw it and miss it the enemy has a 15 second window to eat your ass.

With maxing Q you not only do more potential damage when you do land an E, you're able to throw it out more often, meaning your overall dps is higher, and you're a bigger threat with your harass, esp since you can bend it around minions if you have the mechanics.



Just sum thoughts

I disagree.  As far as I'm concerned, or care, I AM just with my friends.  I don't owe any behavior to you, or anyone.  You don't pay my bills, you don't get up at 4am when I've got a flat and need a ride.  You don't babysit my kids, you don't come over for Christmas.  You're nobody to me.  I owe you nothing.

What have you or anyone else that plays this game ever done for me that I should feel "Obligated" for?  I have no obligation to you.  You haven't earned any obligation from me.

I could give a good god damn what some random person I'm never going to meet in my life thinks of me or the way I act.  When we play, we always try to win.  We're not trolls.  But we may or may not be inebriated, and we may or may not play our best.  We may play champs we never play.  We may play champions in roles that aren't "meta".  It might not work.  It might.  Who knows.  Who cares?

If you want to judge people on how they play, or expect people to adhere to strict social guidelines, play ranked or don't play at all.  

This is a video game.  Not real life.  There IS a difference.  In non ranked, non competitive play, the only objective is to have fun.  Period.  My friends and I accomplish that goal, as do all the other people this post aims to complain about.  Now if you've got someone intentionally feeding, or purposely trying to lose the game because thats "fun" to them.... fuck those people.  Report their asses, that's what its for.  But if I'm drunk, trying to win, playing Karthus jungle, and I don't exactly have the greatest game?  Who cares?  Who the hell are you to tell me I can't do that?  What authority do you have over me?  None.  Zero.  As long as I'm trying to win and I'm playing to the best of my ability, you can't touch me.  Try as you may.

When you go to a bar (if you're even old enough) do you expect people to sit around with their pinkies out and discuss academia, being prim, proper, and polite?  Or do you go expecting a bunch of drunk morons to be acting like drunk morons?

Norms is the same way.  Its norms.  Anything goes.  

Take your expectations to ranked, or take your expectations to another game - or off of video games entirely.  You seem to take it far too seriously.

I imagine the responses to this thread will consist of...

5 or 6 people agreeing with the sentiment.

5 or 6 thousand people all flaming, mocking and insulting the OP for "taking normals too seriously".

For the record, I'm in the first group.  I don't like ranked.  I don't play ranked.  It amplifies the toxic BS of the game tenfold, I've found and I just don't care about climbing or for the stress ranked brings.  I do however, not enjoy games where three people are trying to win while one or two people wander around aimlessly doing stupid crap and not trying at all.  Now I'm all for off-meta stuff in normals... that's fine.  Duo mages bot?  Sure.  Top lane Twitch?  Whatever.  Jungle Taric?  I'd love to see that work.  But play the damned game to win!  You don't need to look up the top winrate build for the top winrate champ and play nothing but that... but whatever you pick, play it as best you can, and play the game to win.  Don't run off to chase kills instead of pushing an objective.  Don't B after an ace when there's something else you could get done.  Don't head off to farm wolves when your team is doing baron.  Don't mindlessly splitpush a lane all game and refuse to group.  (Unless you're Singed or Tryndamere, I guess) 

For me the game is never more frustrating than when it's lost not because of skill but because of stupidity.  Because someone decided to go full derp and threw the game.  "Don't take it seriously" is the excuse of people who KNOW they messed up and want to dismiss it.  No one plays the game to lose it except trolls... and by not giving a shit or even INTENTIONALLY doing something stupid over a better, smarter play you are being a troll.  

Now obviously, what is the best course of action in a LOT of places is a matter of opinion.  Maybe you win a teamfight mid and half the team wants to baron while the other half starts trying to shove mid towers.  Which is better?  That's situational.  Maybe you got a pick but still feel you'd lose a 4v5 and your team wants to go in and try to fight that fed vayne while you'd rather quietly grab an objective or try to gain vision control while they're poorly set up to fight you.  This isn't troll behavior.  What actually IS troll behavior is usually only very obvious to the people in the game, and the stupid bot that handles reports will NEVER realize it.  

There wasn't a point to this rant.  I just kinda felt like putting it out there.
if you're high or drunk and want to have a chill game play vs bots and please don't ruin my game

No. 

While I don't play drunk/high, I don't want to feel the need to tryhard in normals. That's what ranked is for.

Normals is where I get the chance to try new champions, roles, rune setups, etc., without absolutely stomping everything in a bot game. I want to realistically develop a new skill in a PvP environment.

But then there's people, who may be just like you, who see people goofing off (which btw, how do you ACTUALLY know?) or performing poorly, and getting REALLY salty about it. Like I was playing a normal game last night doing APC-Attack Speed Twisted Fate bot lane. I wanted to try something new, against competent players, and see what it was like.

I gave it my best effort. My team flamed me. "This TF does no damage" "He's trolling" "Is he drunk??". The enemy team flamed me. "How can you be so bad" "Why are you trolling?"

My answer: "It's just a normal game, why are you getting to bent out of shape?"

That's the only non-toxic answer I can honestly come up with. I could argue. I could flame back. I could even mute too, but I think even upset teammates can still have valuable input later on in the game. But that's the crux of this. People like you get way too salty or upset when things aren't going your way in a normal game.

Take that attitude to ranked where it will fit in better, and leave players like me to enjoy the game at a moderate difficult in normals.

Ranked: All you care about is winning.

Normals: Still want to win, but you'd like to do something off-meta, or maybe you're just having an off day, or you want to try a new champion/build.

Bots/ARAM: When you want to dick around or play drunk/high.

Any sober person will say not to queue drunk.

It is the act of going against the team for selfish reasons, and it is a defeatist statement, one of giving up. When others on the team may not want to give up.

Instead of accepting responsibility and saying, "yeah that sucked, I hope it doesn't happen again," the person says, "whatever, it's just normals" which really translates to, "I don't care about my performance, if I screw up the game for the team I don't care that it affects you and you shouldn't care so much"

---

If something goes wrong, the better thing to say would be, "It's ok, shit happens," because this is more a statement along the lines of, "It's in the past, we'll do better next time."

It comes down to being willfully dismissive of the team's needs. "It's just normals" is disrespectful and tilting for some others. "Shit happens," and, "hopefully it won't go that badly again" or "we'll try to do better next time" is still putting the event in the past while also maintaining a positive team environment.
